docs.lead_paragraph: Differences over abortion and sex education continued to distance the Bush administration from many of the other delegates to a General Assembly Special Session on Children today, complicating efforts to draft a final declaration due on Friday. Delegates prepared to negotiate through the night to meet the deadline for a document that outlines goals and standards on issues ranging from child labor to immunizations. The three-day session is the General Assembly's first devoted exclusively to children.

headline.main: U.N. Forum Stalls on Sex Education and Abortion Rights

docs.abstract: Efforts to draft final declaration following General Assembly Special Session on Children are being complicated by differences between Bush administration's delegates and many other delegates over abortion and sex education; United States delegation, upholding White House stance against abortion, seeks to amend language arrived at in previous UN conferences so that it excludes abortion from menu of reproductive health services offered to teenagers; in this they are joined by Vatican, as well as several Islamic nations; on opposing side are delegates from European Union, as well as countries in Latin America, Africa and Asia (M)
docs.snippet: Differences over abortion and sex education continued to distance the Bush administration from many of the other delegates to a General Assembly Special Session on Children today, complicating efforts to draft a final declaration due on Friday.   ...

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: FAR EAST, SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ASIA AND PACIFIC AREAS

docs.lead_paragraph: ''We are street children. We are the children of war. We are the victims and orphans of H.I.V./AIDS.'' So declared the small but unshakeable voice of Gabriela Azurdy Arrieta, a 13-year-old from Bolivia this morning at the opening session of the United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Children.

headline.main: U.N. Session Begins to Tally The Perils of Being Young

docs.abstract: United Nations General Assembly opens Special Session on Children; session will assess plight of world's children over 12 years since UN first set concrete goals to improve their lives; will produce new list of goals for 2015; representatives of 300-member children's delegation and Sec Gen Kofi Annan speak; graph and tables on children's health; photo (M)
